JT_Hodges:
{{Short description|American musician and actor (born 1977)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = JT Hodges | image = JT Hodges at 2012 WQYK Santa Fest.jpg | alt = JT Hodges at 2012 WQYK Santa Fest | caption = JT Hodges in December 2012 | image_size = | birth_name = Justin Taylor Hodges | alias = JT | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|7|6}} | birth_place = [[Fort Worth, Texas]] | origin = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter, actor | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | years_active = 2011–present | label = [[Show Dog-Universal Music|Show Dog-Universal]] | associated_acts = [[Toby Keith]] }} '''Justin Taylor Hodges''' (born July 6, 1977) is an American [[country music]] singer and actor. In 2011, he signed to [[Show Dog-Universal Music]] and released one album, which has produced three charting singles on the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart. ==Early life== Justin Taylor Hodges was born on July 6, 1977, and raised in [[Fort Worth, Texas]], by father James McKinley Hodges and mother Marsha Kathleen McDade Hodges.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/HelloJTHodges/status/618077347057569792|title=JT Hodges on Twitter|work=Twitter}}{{cite web|url=https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:VDT8-RGR|title=Person Details for Justin Taylor Hodges, "Texas Birth Index, 1903-1997" — FamilySearch.org|work=familysearch.org}}[http://repertoire.bmi.com/writer.asp?blnWriter=True&blnPublisher=True&blnArtist=True&page=1&fromrow=1&torow=25&querytype=WriterID&keyid=1336997&keyname=HODGES+JUSTIN+TAYLOR&CAE=468872597&Affiliation=BMI Songwriter/Composer: Hodges Justin Taylor]{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/jt-hodges-starts-his-journey-into-a-country-music-career/|title=JT Hodges Starts His 'Journey' into a Country Music Career|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=6 July 2011}} He attended [[The Oakridge School]] for high school and graduated in 1996. He later graduated from [[Texas Christian University]] and moved to [[Los Angeles]], spending several years on the coffeehouse circuit. He met his wife in Jay in California and they moved to Nashville in 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/hodges_jt/bio.jhtml|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130119101950/http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/hodges_jt/bio.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 19, 2013|title=JT Hodges Biography|last=|first=|year=2011|work=[[Country Music Television|CMT]]|accessdate=10 October 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://thetimes-tribune.com/lifestyles-people/eric-church-jt-hodges-join-country-superstar-toby-keith-thursday-1.1199873#axzz1aQoKDUbM|title=Eric Church, JT Hodges join country superstar Toby Keith Thursday|last=McAuliffe|first=Josh|work=The Times Tribune|accessdate=10 October 2011}} ==Musical career== Hodges' parents are both involved in music: his father is a pianist who owns a recording studio in [[Fort Worth, Texas]],{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1669098/jt-hodges-ramps-up-his-hunt-for-country-fans.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002191303/http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1669098/jt-hodges-ramps-up-his-hunt-for-country-fans.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 2, 2011|title=JT Hodges Ramps Up His Hunt for Country Fans|last=Parton|first=Chris|date=17 August 2011|work=[[Country Music Television|CMT]]|accessdate=29 August 2011}} and his mother was briefly signed to [[MCA Nashville]] in the 1980s. She recorded a version of "[[The Bed You Made for Me]]", later a top 5 hit for [[Highway 101]] in 1987.{{cite journal|last=Phillips|first=Jessica|date=5 September 2011|title=Who's New: JT Hodges|journal=[[Country Weekly]]|volume=18|issue=36|page=18|issn=1074-3235}} In mid-2011, Hodges signed to [[Show Dog-Universal Music]] and released his debut single, "Hunt You Down", which he co-wrote with [[Rivers Rutherford]] and [[Mark Collie]]. Billy Dukes of Taste of Country gave the song four stars out of five, saying that it had an "infectious melody" but criticizing the lyrics for being "too cool for the room".{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/jt-hodges-hunt-you-down/|title=JT Hodges — 'Hunt You Down' Single Review|last=Dukes|first=Billy|date=May 27, 2011|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=6 July 2011}} Kyle Ward gave an identical rating at Roughstock, also saying that the song had an original sound, although he thought that the "story is a bit implausible" and said that he did not understand the song's bridge.{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/jt-hodges-hunt-you-down-|title=JT Hodges — 'Hunt You Down'|last=Ward|first=Kyle|date=June 22, 2011|work=Roughstock|access-date=6 July 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629090755/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/jt-hodges-hunt-you-down-|archive-date=2011-06-29|url-status=dead}} Hodges' debut album includes eleven songs, nine of which he co-wrote.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/jt-hodges-starts-his-journey-into-a-country-music-career/|title=JT Hodges Starts His 'Journey' Into a Country Music Career|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|date=17 June 2011|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=29 August 2011}} "Goodbyes Made You Mine" and "Sleepy Little Town" also charted from it. Hodges joined [[Toby Keith]]'s 2011 Locked and Loaded Tour.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/jt-hodges-toby-keith-2011-tour/|title=JT Hodges Joins Toby Keith's 2011 Locked and Loaded Tour|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=6 July 2011}} In 2015, Hodges released an EP, titled ''Locks on Doors''.{{cite web |url=http://www.axs.com/review-jt-hodges-stirs-up-a-musical-hurricane-with-locks-on-doors-ep-50495 |title=Review: JT Hodges stirs up a musical hurricane with 'Locks on Doors' EP |work =AXS |author=Jason Scott |date= April 24, 2015 }} The EP sold 500 copies in its debut week.{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/04/34665-country-album-chart-report-for-april-29-2015/ |title=Country Album Chart Report For April 29, 2015 |author= Matt Bjorke |date= April 29, 2015 |work=Roughstock }} Sales figure given [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ioGGYQZAR9S3KGRifUYU0peTSyuHChJRE6s9C0J2sfg/edit#gid=0 here] ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Details ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]

Director |- | 2011 ! scope="row"| "Hunt You Down" | [[Marcel (singer)|Marcel]] |- | 2012 ! scope="row"| "Goodbyes Made You Mine" | rowspan="2"| Mason Dixon |- | 2014 ! scope="row"| "Already High" |- | 2015 ! scope="row"| "Ray Bans"{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/videos/jt-hodges/1223983/ray-bans.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150806065715/http://www.cmt.com/videos/jt-hodges/1223983/ray-bans.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 6, 2015|title=CMT : Videos : JT Hodges : Ray Bans|publisher=[[Country Music Television]]|accessdate=July 30, 2015}} | rowspan="2"| Marcel |- | 2016 ! scope="row"| "After Midnight" |- |} == Filmography== * ''[https://www.hallmarkmoviesandmysteries.com/finding-christmas Finding Christmas]'' 2013 {{IMDb title|tt2964654}}{{cite news|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|title=JT Hodges Releases Holiday Classic "Joy to the World"|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/news/jt-hodges-releases-holiday-classic-joy-world|accessdate=17 December 2013|newspaper=countryweekly.com|date=5 November 2013}} * ''[[Verizon Super Bowl Central Kickoff Concert]]'' {{IMDb title|tt4611060|Verizon Super Bowl Central Kickoff Concert}} * ''[[The Dust Storm (2015 film)|The Dust Storm]]'' {{IMDb title|tt3854372|The Dust Storm}} * Christmas Stars 2019 * Christina In The Country Season 1 Episode 6 2023 ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{official website|http://jthodges.com/}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hodges, Jt}} [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actors from Fort Worth, Texas]] [[Category:Musicians from Fort Worth, Texas]] [[Category:Show Dog-Universal Music artists]] [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]]
